text: is a Japanese video game developer that specializes in rhythm games. It was co-founded by Keiichi Yano on February 3, 1997 as iNiS Ltd. The name iNiS is an acronym and it stands for "infinite Noise of the inner Soul." In 2000, the company changed name to iNiS Corporation. ==Subsidiaries== * SONICA Co., Ltd.: Established in 2001, it is a provider of sound solutions. ==Titles developed== ===CD/DVD-ROM=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Title!!Platform!!Release Date |- |Penguin Piano||?|| |- |Space Battleship Yamato Master Edition CD- ROM||Windows/Mac OS hybrid|| |- |Space Battleship Yamato Master Edition DVD- ROM||DVD player||? |- |Picasso||?||?(1997–2000) |- |Safari Tokyo||Windows|| |- |Kiseki No Maya Uranai||?|| |- |Minna no Tabetaku Ver.2||?|| |- |Roland VP-9000 promo CD-ROM||?(CD-ROM)|| |} ===Video Games=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Title!!Platform!!Release Date |- |beatmania Da!!||Windows/Mac OS hybrid|| |- |beatmania BEST Da!!||Windows/Mac OS hybrid||, (rerelease) |- |pop'n music Da!!||Windows/Mac OS hybrid||, (rerelease) |- |Gitaroo Man||PlayStation 2|| |- |Gundam Pilot Academy||Arcade|| |- |Osu!
